column2:
Type: withdrawal

Category: ifs_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 27.02.2025

Lock Description (en): Two major non-confirmities raised during the technical review of the IFS audit report : - 4.3.2 : On the label of the product Madeleine Nature au sel de Guérande et au Beurre fin, 100g the ingredients for the baking powder are not up to date. On the Carif supplier data sheet, the baking powder ingredients are as follows: E450, E500, wheat flour, wheat starch or on the madeleine label the ingredients for the baking powder are as follows: E450i, E500ii, wheat flour, wheat starch 5.5.2 : St Fort site: In accordance with the ‘St Fort weighing control sheet’ record (E-CDT-014 dated 10/09/2024), the operator manually fills and weighs all the bags of plain madeleines individually on a legal-for-trade scale. The compliance criteria are: average of weights recorded greater than the nominal weight and no bag below a target weight. - The record indicates that only a certain number of weighings are recorded, depending on the size of the batch, whereas the batch is in fact 100% controlled. - for the product seen in production (plain madeleines), the operator says that a weight of 98g is tolerated, whereas the nominal weight is 100g/bag. This tolerance of 98g for a product weighing 100g is clearly stated on the form. - This recording form does not include a space for noting the weighings from the 81st, whereas for batches of less than 100 pieces, 100% of the weighings must be noted. The procedure in place does not comply, because in the case of manual filling with 100% weighing/control, the actual weight cannot be less than the nominal weight.

Lock Description (other language): Deux non-conformités majeures ont été soulevées lors de la revue technique du rapport d'audit IFS : - 4.3.2 : Sur l'étiquette du produit Madeleine Nature au sel de Guérande et au Beurre fin, 100g les ingrédients concernant la poudre à lever ne sont pas à jour. Sur la fiche technique du fournisseur Carif, les ingrédients de la poudre à lever sont les suivants: E450, E500, farine de blé, amidon de blé or sur l'étiquette de la madeleine les ingrédients de la poudre à lever sont les suivants: E450i, E500ii, farine de froment (blé), amidon de blé. -5.5.2 : Site St Fort: Conformément à l’enregistrement « Fiche de contrôle des pesées St Fort » (E-CDT-014 du 10/09/2024), l'opératrice remplit manuellement et pèse tous les sachets de madeleines nature individuellement sur une balance à métrologie légale. Les critères de conformité sont : moyenne des pesées notées supérieure au poids nominal et aucun sachet en dessous d’un poids cible. - L’enregistrement indique de ne noter qu’un certain nombre de pesées en fonction de la taille du lot, alors que le lot est en réalité contrôlé à 100% - pour le produit vu en production (madeleines nature), l'opératrice dit tolérer un poids de 98g alors que le poids nominal est de 100g / sachet. Cette tolérance de 98g sur un produit de 100g est bien présente dans le formulaire - ce formulaire d’enregistrement ne prévoit pas de place pour noter les pesées à partir de la 81ème, alors que pour les lots en dessous de 100pièces, 100% des pesées doivent être notées. La procédure en place n’est pas conforme car en cas de remplissage manuel avec pesée/contrôle à 100%, le poids réel ne peut être inférieur au poids nominal

Type: withdrawal

Category: ifs_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 05.03.2025

Lock Description (en): The Major Non conformity is on requirement 4.1.2.5: On the cardboard package of butter biscuits with milk chocolate or white chocolate or dark chocolate “Les Malins Plaisirs” of the brand M. from the distributor A…, it is indicated the claim “Belgian Chocolate” with a Belgian flag logo. For the production of the article biscuits with milk chocolate of this brand on 24/01/2025, this labelled claim was not respected. Between 07/01/2025 and 24/01/2025, 4 receipts of milk chocolates took place in the bulk tank of the site, coming from a German factory. The last receipt of chocolate from a Belgian factory dated from 06/01/2025. As the tank was not completely empty at the time of receipts, by means of a dilution calculation, on the date of production of 24/01/2025, the proportion of Belgian chocolate used in the product represented approximately 0.22%. The site has not implemented a system to ensure compliance with this labelled claim during its production

Lock Description (other language): Sur l’étui des biscuits au beurre avec chocolat au lait ou chocolat blanc ou chocolat noir « Les Malins Plaisirs » de la marque M. du distributeur A… est indiquée la mention « Chocolat Belge » avec un logo drapeau belge. Pour la production de la référence biscuits avec tablette chocolat au lait du 24/01/2025 de cette marque, cette allégation étiquetée n’a pas été respectée. Entre le 07/01/2025 et le 24/01/2025, 4 réceptions de chocolats au lait ont eu lieu dans le tank vrac du site, en provenance d’une usine allemande. La dernière réception de chocolat provenant d’une usine belge datait du 06/01/2025. Comme le tank n’était pas totalement vide au moment des réceptions, par le biais d’un calcul de dilution, à la date de la production du 24/01/2025, la proportion de chocolat belge utilisée dans le produit représentait environ 0.22%. Le site n’a pas mis en place n’a pas mis en place un système permettant de s’assurer du respect de cette allégation de l’étiquetage lors de ses productions.

Type: withdrawal

Category: ifs_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 21.02.2025

Lock Description (en): A Major non-conformity was raised during the audit on February 18-19, 2024. Description of the Major NC: - Clause 3.4.2: “During the tour, it has been observed several empty food packagings (external food) in a trash bin located in the maintenance office, including foods containing allergen not handled onsite (ex : peanuts). In this area, it is not allowed to bring any foods or drinks (external foods or drinks are only allowed in the canteen area where additional rules apply ex : overcoat to be worn by technician or no work clothes). In this office, technicians wear the same work clothes when working in the production area for intervention. These external foods could contaminate the work clothes of technicians and cross contaminate the product or production lines with allergens.”

Type: withdrawal

Category: ifs_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 27.01.2025

Lock Description (en): During the audit on 21, 22 and 23 January 2025, A KO non-conformity was issued for requirement 5.11.3: Several shortcomings were observed with regard to the follow-up of corrective actions: - The corrective action ‘modification of the Comas line footbridge’ following the deviation of the May 2024 IFS audit on requirement 4.12.2 has not been carried out to date. In the IFS action plan, the planned completion date is 30/09/2024. An estimate is currently being drawn up for the site. - The corrective action ‘verification of the effectiveness of cleaning actions during the monthly hygiene audit’ defined following the deviation noted D in the IFS audit of May 2024 on requirement 4.10.2 is not effective in view of the observations of recurring cleaning defects. Moreover, this hygiene audit has not been updated since October 2023 so as to be able to target the equipment affected by the IFS deviation of May 2024. - The implementation of the corrections following the internal audit of 10 and 11 December 2024 are tracked in the internal audit report, but no analysis of the causes and corrective actions has been established to prevent the recurrence of deviations. - The ‘audit conclusion and corrective actions’ section was not completed for the monthly hygiene audits in November and December 2024. In addition, the ‘comments’ column for areas noted as ‘not clean’ has not been completed to specify the equipment that is not clean, the corrections or corrective actions in the checklist. - Corrective actions other than those defined following a non-conformity form, a customer complaint or an IFS audit are not formulated or documented (case of corrective actions linked to deviations during internal audits, non-conformities linked to hygiene inspections). A major non-conformity was issued for requirement 4.10.2: The D grade from the previous audit was downgraded following the observation of recurring deviations from requirement 4.10.2. At the time of the current assessment, some areas were poorly cleaned and are now being cleaned again: - Accumulation of sugar dust on the floor behind the CEPI machine - Presence of product residue (egg white) on the motor and cable tray of the OVO concept machine - One of the 3 evaporator grids in the cold room (no bare products) shows black marks. - Dust (sugar) above the grinder, on the hose and floor/wall junctions below the sugar grinder. Further observations of poorly cleaned areas: - Storage/reception area: Dirty floor with black residue and accumulation next to the pallet of caster sugar. - Cold storage room for eggs: blackened floor towards the bottom with residue (egg agglomerate) under the piping system and along the wall of the room. Siphon with whitish residue. The syphon is to be cleaned 1/day in accordance with cleaning plan A-IGN-001 version 3. - Ovoconcept cleaning tank: presence of a film and whitish residue that may come off. - Cleaning unit at the dishwasher: the ‘yellow’ hose is black from the inside. - Kremers packaging: the meringue recovery hopper is dirty around the edges and the unused belt is not clean (white residue clinging to it). There is an accumulation of sugar dust in the chute before the weighing machines. The equipment is recorded as being cleaned after each use. - Grinder in sugar room: there is a small pile of grass on a support and brown residue on the top. There was no contact with the product at this point.

Lock Description (other language): Lors de l’audit des 21, 22 et 23 janvier 2025, Une non-conformité KO a été émise sur l’exigence 5.11.3 : Il a été observé plusieurs manquements relatifs au suivi des actions correctives : - L'action corrective "modification de la passerelle de la ligne Comas" suite à la déviation de l’audit IFS de mai 2024 sur l'exigence 4.12.2 n'est pas réalisée à date. Dans le plan d'actions IFS, la date de réalisation prévue est notée au 30/09/2024. Un devis est en cours au niveau du site. - L'action corrective "vérification de l'efficacité des actions de nettoyage lors de l'audit mensuel hygiène" définie suite à la déviation notée D de l'audit IFS de mai 2024 sur l'exigence 4.10.2 n'est pas efficace à la vue d'observations de défauts de nettoyage récurrents. Cet audit hygiène n'a d'ailleurs pas été mis à jour depuis octobre 2023 de façon à pouvoir cibler les équipements concernés par la déviation IFS de mai 2024. - La réalisation des corrections suite à l'audit interne du 10 et 11 décembre 2024 sont suivies sur le rapport d'audit interne mais il n'est établi d'analyse des causes et d'actions correctives pour éviter la récurrence des déviations. - L'encart "conclusion de l'audit et actions correctives" n'est pas complété pour les audits hygiènes mensuels de novembre et décembre 2024. De plus, la colonne "commentaires" des zones notées comme "non propre" n'est pas complété pour préciser les équipements non propres, les corrections ou actions correctives dans la check-list. - Les actions correctives autres que celles définies suite à une fiche de non-conformité, une réclamation client ou un audit IFS ne sont pas formulées ni documentées (cas des actions correctives liées aux déviations en audits internes, non-conformités liées à aux inspections hygiène). Une non-conformité majeure a été émise sur l’exigence 4.10.2. : La note D du précédent audit est dégradée suite à l'observation d'écarts récurrents sur l'exigence 4.10.2. Lors de la présente évaluation, des zones étaient mal nettoyées et le sont à nouveau : - Accumulation de poussière de sucre au niveau du sol derrière la machine CEPI - Présence de résidus de produit (blanc d'œuf) sur le moteur et le chemin de câbles de la machine OVO concept - Une des 3 grilles d'évaporateur de la chambre froide (absence de produits nus) présente des traces noires. - Poussières (sucre) au-dessus du broyeur, sur le flexible et les jonctions sol/mur en dessous du broyeur à sucre. De nouvelles observations de zones mal nettoyées sont observées : - Zone de stockage/réception : Sol sale avec des résidus noirs et accumulation à côté de la palette de sucre semoule. - Chambre froide stockage oeuf : Sol noirci vers le fond avec résidus (agglomérat d'oeuf) sous le système de tuyauterie et le long du mur du local. Siphon avec résidus blanchâtre. Un nettoyage du syphon est prévu 1/jour selon le plan de nettoyage A-IGN-001 version 3 - Cuve de nettoyage pour l'ovoconcept : présence d'un film et résidus blanchâtres pouvant se détacher. - Centrale de nettoyage au niveau de la plonge : le tuyau "jaune" est noir de l'intérieur. - Conditionnement Kremers : la trémie de récupération des meringues est encrassée sur les bords et le tapis non utilisé n'est pas propre (résidus blanc accroché). Une accumulation de poussière de sucre est présente au niveau de la descente avant les pesons. L'équipement est enregistré comme nettoyé après chaque utilisation. - Broyeur dans local sucre : présence d'un petit amas d'herbe sur un support et de résidus marron sur le dessus. Il n'y a pas de contact avec le produit à cet endroit. - Local sucre : présence de coulures de sucre au niveau de la poutre au plafond et des murs.

Type: suspension

Category: other_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 03.03.2025

Lock Description (en): NSF is taking this action to suspend the site's certification in response to the results of the unannounced verification audit completed 2025-02-19 regarding a complaint filed with BRCGS. The complaint referenced site issues with flour beetles (tribolium) in processing areas, areas of the silos that presented an entry way for pests or pest harborage, water or condensation infiltration and the lack of routine checks. Upon NSF's investigation it was determined that the silo conditions were not compliant with BRCGS/IFS Standards and poses a potential risk to product.

Type: withdrawal

Category: ifs_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 24.01.2025

Lock Description (en): Major 2.3.9.4 After the mixer, the biscuit cream is sieved on a stainless steel grid with a 5mm mesh. This sieving is considered to be PRPo (control of foreign bodies). During the audit, two meshes of this grid were found to be missing. However, the integrity check carried out just prior to the audit had been deemed compliant. After investigation, it turns out that this anomaly was known. Even though a metal detector is positioned behind the grid and no claims for foreign bodies have been recorded for this product, this discrepancy is considered to be a major non-conformity linked to the failure to control the monitoring procedure for this PRPo.

Lock Description (other language): Majeur 2.3.9.4: En sortie du malaxeur, la crème de biscuit est tamisée sur une grille inox ayant des mailles de 5mm. Ce tamisage est considéré en PRPo (maîtrise des corps étrangers). Lors de l'audit, deux mailles de cette grille ont été observées manquantes. Or le contrôle de son intégrité, réalisé juste avant, avait été jugé conforme. Après investigation, il s’avère que cette anomalie était connue. Même si un détecteur de métaux est positionné derrière et qu’aucune réclamation pour corps étranger n’a été répertorié sur ce produit, cet écart est considéré en non conformité majeure en lien avec la non maîtrise de la procédure de surveillance de ce PRPo.

Type: withdrawal

Category: ifs_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 10.01.2025

Lock Description (en): KO to Requirement 4.18.1: During the recertification audit of January 07-08-09, 2025, it was found that for the batch of counter labels X0222700 “Grand Courtage”, the comparison between the physical stock and the computerized stock revealed a batch inversion. In fact, the physical stock contained 2 reels (2 x 10,000 counter labels) from a 2021 delivery, whereas the batch received in 2022 (seen on the computer receipts) had been consumed, as it was no longer present in the physical stock. Traceability is ensured by monitoring batch consumption on a FIFO (First In - First Out) basis, but in this case, FIFO was not respected and traceability is no longer ensured, hence the non-compliant assessment of requirement 4.18.1 (KO). Furthermore, for another case of the “Grandin” counter label from batch X0532248, the physical stock is 2,500 counter labels. However, it was found that 2 x 500 counter-labels of the same batch had been recorded on receipt, i.e. 1000 counter-labels in computerized stock. The manager immediately rectified the stock.

Lock Description (other language): KO à l’exigence 4.18.1 : Lors de l’audit de recertification des 07-08-09 janvier 2025, il a été constaté que pour le lot de contre étiquettes X0222700 « Grand Courtage », la comparaison entre le stock physique et le stock informatique a révélé une inversion de lots. En effet, il y avait dans le stock physique 2 bobines (2 x 10 000 contre étiquettes) d’une livraison de 2021 alors que le lot reçu en 2022 (vu sur les réceptions informatiques) a été consommé car plus présent dans le stock physique. La traçabilité est assurée par le suivi de la consommation des lots en FIFO (First In – First Out) or dans ce cas, le FIFO n’a pas été respecté et la traçabilité n’est plus assurée, d’où l’évaluation non-conforme de l’exigence 4.18.1 (KO). De plus, pour un autre cas de contre étiquette « Grandin » du lot X0532248, le stock physique est de 2500 contre étiquettes. Cependant, il a été constaté que lors des réceptions, il a été enregistré 2 x 500 contre étiquettes du même lot, soit 1000 contre étiquettes en stock informatique. La rectification de stock a été aussitôt réalisée par le responsable.

Type: withdrawal

Category: ifs_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 24.02.2025

Lock Description (en): KO on 5.11.3 : The non-conformities identified during the internal audits of Management (carried out on 06/18/2024 => 1 NC), human resources (carried out on 06/18/2024 => 4 NC) and HACCP (carried out on 05/23/2024 => 23 NC), having not been recorded, the necessary corrections and corrective actions were not defined, nor were they subject to planning with responsibilities and expected completion deadlines.

Lock Description (other language): Ko sur le 5.11.3: Les non-conformités identifiées lors des audits internes de la Direction (réalisé le 18/06/2024 => 1 NC), des ressources humaines (réalisé le 18/06/2024 => 4 NC) et de l'HACCP (réalisé le 23/05/2024 => 23 NC), n'ayant pas été enregistrées, les corrections et actions correctives nécessaires n’ont pas été définies, ni fait l'objet d'une planification avec les responsabilités et les délais attendus de réalisation.

Type: withdrawal

Category: ifs_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 07.03.2025

Lock Description (en): During the IFS audit carried out from 3 to 5 March 2025, 2 major non-conformities and 1 KO were detected: KO 4.12.1: The auditor found that the equipment used to scrape boneless ropes had a sharp metal blade broken in two places. The equipment was in use on the day of the audit, and no report was made of any damage to the blade. As the blade has not been inspected, it is impossible to know how long it has been broken. There are no adequate control measures for this type of contamination (no metal detector). Proven risk for the end consumer. One person checks knives daily to ensure they are in good condition. This check is not documented and is poorly carried out, as a knife with a very fine, potentially brittle tip has been observed. The procedure involves deliberately “grinding” the knife tips to prevent any risk of physical contamination. The site is not equipped with a metal detector. NC Major 4.19.3: The Provençal coating supplier's data sheet indicates cross-contamination with several allergens. ACLV's GSA allergen questionnaire (food safety guarantee) completed by its supplier on this subject confirms that these cross-contaminations are not under control, and informs its customer accordingly. The site's quality department has not taken the measure of this information to assess the risks and decide whether or not to label this raw material for cross-contamination. It should be noted that this ingredient accounts for 0.27% of the finished product NC major 5.5.1: For the article “émince cube provençal” in a 200g net fixed-weight tray, the weighing system allows products with a net weight of 192g to pass through, whereas the procedure provides for the isolation of all products whose weight is less than the nominal weight due to the absence of a label. Under such conditions, and since the company does not record the weighing of prepackaged products, it cannot justify the batch's compliance with regulatory requirements. In fact, the company performs weighing operations when the product is put into trays, with instructions to fill to the nominal weight, but does not record these weighings.

Lock Description (other language): Lors de l'audit IFS réalisé du 3 au 5 mars 2025, 2 non-conformités majeures et 1 KO ont été détectées : KO 4.12.1 : L'auditeur a constaté que l'équipement de raclage des râbles désossés présentait une lame métallique tranchante cassée à deux endroits. L'équipement a été utilisé le jour de l'audit et aucun signalement n'a été fait sur la dégradation de la lame. En l'absence de contrôle de la lame, il est impossible de connaître depuis quand elle est cassée. Il n'existe pas de mesure de maîtrise suffisante pour ce type de contamination (absence de détecteur de métaux). Risque avéré pour le consommateur final. Une personne réalise le contrôle journalier des couteaux pour garantir leur bon état. Ce contrôle n'est pas documenté et est mal réalisé car il a été vu un couteau dont la pointe est très fine, potentiellement cassante. La procédure prévoit de "meuler" volontairement les pointes des couteaux pour prévenir tout risque de contamination physique. Le site n'est pas équipé de détecteur de métaux. NC majeure 4.19.3 : La fiche technique du fournisseur de l’enrobage provençal indique des contaminations croisées avec plusieurs allergènes. Le questionnaire allergène GSA d’ACLV (garantie sécurité alimentaire) complété par son fournisseur sur ce sujet confirme la non maîtrise de ces contaminations croisées et en informe ainsi son client. Le service qualité du site n'a pas pris la mesure de cette information pour en évaluer les risques et décider de l'étiquetage ou non des contaminations croisées de cette matière première. Notons que cet ingrédient entre à hauteur de 0,27% dans le produit fini. NC majeure 5.5.1 : Pour l'article "émince cube provençal" en barquette de 200g net poids fixe, le système de pesée laisse passer des produits dont le poids net est de 192g, alors que la procédure prévoit un isolement de tous produits dont le poids est inférieur au poids nominal par l'absence d'étiquette. Dans de telles conditions et l'entreprise n'enregistrant pas les pesées des produits préemballés, elle ne peut donc pas justifier de la conformité du lot aux exigences réglementaires. Par ailleurs, l’entreprise réalise la pesée lors de la mise en barquette avec pour consigne de remplissage le poids nominal, mais sans enregistrement de ces pesées.

Type: withdrawal

Category: ifs_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 13.11.2024

Lock Description (en): A KO has been placed on requirement 5.1.1 for the following reasons: - There is no risk analysis to justify the frequency of internal audits, and the 2024 internal audit schedule has not been followed: the freezer service provider's audit, scheduled 5 times a year, was planned only once, in October, and not carried out at the time of the IFS audit. - It was not possible to check that the internal audits had been carried out correctly within a 15-month period. - 2 traceability tests scheduled for 2024 and only one carried out. The internal audit program was not deemed sufficiently effective, as deviations identified during this IFS audit should have been identified during internal audits, such as : - internal purchasing audit of 14.3.24 : The requirements on subcontracting were not audited during the purchasing audit and are listed as not applicable, although there is a freezer subcontractor. The report does not mention the audit date or the auditor. - The audit report on fraud is not sufficiently complete and does not mention the elements that were seen during this audit: only the update of the fraud review. However, during the IFS audit, it was noted that there was no purchasing procedure and that the listing of the new supplier of fairground meat had not been done in a structured way (absence of supplier evaluation questionnaire, CDC signed after the first receptions...). - For the maintenance audit of 11.6.24: the action leader was not noted, and no deadline for implementing the action was specified.

Lock Description (other language): Un KO a été mis sur l’exigence 5.1.1 pour les raisons suivantes : - Il n’y a pas d’analyse de risque permettant de justifier la fréquence des audits internes et le planning d’audit interne 2024 n’a pas été suivi : audit du prestataire congélation prévu 5x par an et planifié une seule fois en octobre et non réalisé au moment de l’audit IFS. - Il n’a pas été possible de vérifier la bonne réalisation des audits internes dans une période de 15 mois. - 2 tests traçabilité de prévu au planning 2024 et un seul de réalisé. Le programme d’audit interne n’a pas été jugé suffisamment efficace, des déviations relevées lors de cet audit IFS auraient du être identifiées lors des audits internes, comme par exemple : - audit interne achat du 14.3.24 : Les exigences sur la sous traitance n’ont pas été auditées lors de l’audit achats et sont mises en non applicable or il existe une sous-traitance de congélation. Le rapport ne mentionne pas la date de l’audit ni l’auditeur. - Le rapport d’audit sur la fraude n’est pas suffisamment complet et ne fait pas état des éléments qui ont été vu lors de cet audit : seule la mise à jour de la revue Fraude. Or lors de l’audit IFS, il a été constaté qu’il n’y avait pas de procédure achats et que le référencement du nouveau fournisseur de viande foraine n’avait pas été fait de façon structurée (absence de questionnaire d’évaluation fournisseur, CDC signé après les premières réceptions…). - Pour l’audit maintenance du 11.6.24 : le pilote de l’action n’est pas noté et aucun délai de mise en place de l’action n’est précisé

Type: withdrawal

Category: ifs_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 21.10.2024

Lock Description (en): 4.9.4.1-MAJOR During the field audit, 2 leaks were observed at the end of the morning in the ceiling of the extrusion packaging workshop in the sensitive post-cure-cooling zone: one above the D3 packaging line causing numerous drops of water on the bottom film before the product was applied manually (line not in operation at the time of the observation), and one at the workstation of the atmosphere packaging line operator with soggy records and table (line in operation at the time of the observation). Prior to the auditor's observation, there had been no documented alert concerning this situation, nor had any corrective action been taken (e.g. marking out or blocking off the area). 4.19.2-MAJOR The gluten allergen is present in the West Indian black pudding recipe but not in the other white and black pudding recipes. There are no traces of gluten allergen declared on the boudin family labels. However, the elements validating this control are relatively brief: one analysis on the finished product in 2018 and 1 in 2021, both gluten-free. There has been no surface analysis for gluten carried out on the equipment, uniforms and PPE of the personnel, either in the raw area (cutting, embossing) or in the post-cooking area (manual preparation in trays on the table). Also, during the field audit, the flow of products and personnel was seen to be discontinuous between the cooling of products and their packaging (table-top tray packing stage), without any specific rules being in place for sectoring equipment (plastic crates, for example) or changing uniforms (apron and plastic sleeves). This point is rated as a major NC, because given the 7% bread content in the West Indian boudin recipe, the risk of cross-contamination appears to be uncontrolled.

Lock Description (other language): 4.9.4.1-Majeure Lors de l'audit terrain , il a été constaté en fin de matinée 2 fuites au niveau du plafond de l'atelier conditionnement boudins en zone sensible post cuisson refroidissement : une au dessus de la ligne conditionnement D3 provoquant de nombreuses gouttes d'eau sur le film inférieur avant dépose manuelle du produit (ligne non en fonctionnement au moment du constat), une au niveau du poste de travail de la conductrice de ligne de conditionnement sous atmosphère avec enregistrements et table détrempés (ligne en fonctionnement lors du constat). Avant le constat effectué par l'auditeur, il n'y a pas eu d'alerte documentée concernant cette situation, ni de correction mise en place (par exemple balisage ou blocage de zone). 4.19.2-majeure L'allergène gluten est présent dans la recette de boudin antillais mais pas dans les autres recettes de boudin blanc et boudin noir. Il n y a pas de traces d'allergène gluten déclarées sur les étiquetages de la famille boudins. Or les éléments validant cette maitrise sont relativement succincts : une analyse sur produit fini en 2018 et 1 en 2021, les 2 en absence gluten. Il n’y a pas d’analyse de surface recherchant le gluten effectuée sur les matériels, les tenues et EPI du personnel, ni dans la zone cru (cutterrage, embossage), ni dans la zone post cuisson (préparation manuelle en barquette sur table). Egalement, lors de l'audit terrain, le flux produit et personnel a été visualisé discontinu entre la sortie refroidissement des produits et leur conditionnement (étape de mise en barquette sur table), sans que des règles spécifiques de sectorisation pour les matériels (cagettes plastiques par exemple) et de changement pour les tenues (tablier et manchettes plastiques) ne soient en place. Ce point est noté NC majeure, car compte tenu des 7 % de pain dans la recette boudin antillais, le risque de contamination croisée apparait non maitrisé.

Type: withdrawal

Category: ifs_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 26.11.2024

Lock Description (en): Major non-conformity raised during the IFS certification audit, dated 19 to 22/11/2024, against item 5.6.4: Following the last audit, the difference in the carbohydrate content of Emmenthal breaded products already on the market, compared with the rate indicated on the label, was confirmed by an additional analysis. There were therefore 3 analyses which revealed a carbohydrate content 20% higher than the 12% indicated on the label: 18.5%, 20.7% and 15.1%. A decision was taken to modify the pack in December 2023, but this decision was not followed by action. The nutrition labelling on these products therefore does not comply with Article 31 of Regulation (EU) No. 1169/2011, in conjunction with the Commission's December 2012 Guide to setting tolerances for nutrition declared on labels.

Lock Description (other language): Non-conformité majeure détectée lors de l'audit de certification IFS des 19 au 22/11/2024, sur l'item 5.6.4: Suite au dernier audit, la différence de teneur en glucides des panés à l'emmental, déjà commercialisés, par rapport au taux indiqué sur l'étiquette a été confirmée par une analyse supplémentaire. Il y a donc eu 3 analyses qui ont révélé une teneur en glucides 20% supérieure au taux de 12% indiqué sur l’étiquetage : 18.5%, 20.7% et 15,1%. La modification du pack a été décidée en décembre 2023 mais cette décision n'a pas été suivie d'effet. L'étiquetage nutritionnel de ces produits est donc non conforme à l’article 31 du Règlement (UE) N° 1169/2011 associé au Guide de la Commission de Décembre 2012 relatif à la fixation de tolérances pour les valeurs nutritionnelles déclarées sur les étiquettes.

Type: withdrawal

Category: ifs_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 15.11.2024

Lock Description (en): In the IFS Food announced recertification audit performed on November 12th to 14th, 2024, 2 D Scoring in a KO requirement non-conformity were identified on requirement 2.9.3.1. and 5.11.3.: “KO 2.9.3.1 Monitoring of the new CCP 3 turner/blower of the packaging line for matured cream in glass jars defined in the HACCP-104 - V005 plan of 13/03/2024 is not implemented on site: the compressed air pressure check at the start of each shift is neither carried out nor recorded. The recording sheet for the various checks to be carried out on this line (DE 1448) does not provide for an air pressure recording area. The only check of the correct operation of the turner blower and the line shutdown device in the event of a drop in air pressure is carried out monthly during preventive maintenance of the equipment”. “KO 5.11.3 The PRPo detection of foreign bodies by X-ray on line 808 provides for the re inspection of products on backup equipment in the event of failure of the on line equipment. During the audit on 12 and 13/11/2024, the X-ray on the line was out of order and the re-inspection of the products could not be demonstrated. The traceability test carried out on a matured cream packaged on the same line 808 on 12/09/2024 shows an identical situation: out of order X-ray without demonstrated re-inspection. To date, the site is still waiting for parts to restart the equipment, but this recurring situation has not been the subject of effective and relevant corrective actions to guarantee control of this PRPo.)”.

Type: withdrawal

Category: ifs_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 03.02.2025

Lock Description (en): KO on 4.18.1 : The following points were noted during the site visit on 30/01/2025: - The batch number of the culture medium used to prepare the ferments recorded on the FE PRO 086 tracking sheet dated January 2025 is incorrect. The batch number used since 27/01/2025 is 40146822349 (batch number and date of use noted on the bag in the ferments fridge. - On 01/01/2025, 1 L of brine was added, according to the tracking sheet, but the nature of the product added is not specified (we deduce that it was lactic acid because the addition was made following a non-compliant pH), but the batch number is not recorded on the brine traceability tracking sheet. - Generally speaking, the traceability tracking sheet for incorporated materials (ferments, rennet, etc.) FR PRO 086 vp sometimes shows lines, sometimes empty boxes. Their meaning is not very clear: a line would be identical to the previous day, but sometimes boxes are left empty for ingredients incorporated every day, as for example for thermophilic ferments on 09/01/2025. - Recording of certain key manufacturing parameters such as the temperature of the milk in the vat on 30/01/2025 or the inhibitor monitoring point on 29 and 30/01/2025 is not done. Traceability of manufacturing inputs and key manufacturing parameters is therefore not guaranteed.

Type: withdrawal

Category: ifs_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 05.03.2025

Lock Description (en): During the audit performed on 3rd March 2025 to 4th March 2025, it was detected a KO and Major non-conformity under the requirements 4.12.1. y 4.9.8.4. KO 4.12.1. During the audit, deficiencies in contamination control were identified: 1. Bread molds with deteriorated coating: - Bread molds were found with widespread chipping and detachment of the silicone/Teflon coating, posing a direct contamination risk due to material particle shedding. - It was confirmed that these molds were last used in production on 08/01/2025 (Batch 2025030300, 72 units) and previously on 03/01/2025 (Batch 2025010300, 288 units), demonstrating that they have been in contact with the product in this condition. The last coating treatment was carried out on 02/05/2024. The company states that no customer complaints have been reported. 2. Contamination with water and residues in the production line: - It was observed that the bread scoring machine uses a water jet, with excess water dripping onto the equipment and subsequently onto the loaves in the tins passing underneath, wetting them with water that had been in contact with the machine. Notably, the equipment showed an accumulation of residues from previous productions adhered to the sides and surfaces. The flow of this water, after coming into contact with the equipment and the accumulated residues, and subsequently dripping onto the product, results in contamination. - The tin loading area also showed an accumulation of residues from previous productions on the upper surfaces and condensation dripping directly onto the product. Major non-conformity 4.9.8.4. During the audit, it was confirmed that the kneading and product forming area of the bakery continues to show a significant accumulation of starch on floors and equipment, originating from the starches and flours used in the process. This situation reflects the recurrence of the deviation detected in the previous year's audit. While this generation is an inherent effect of this type of activity, the observed accumulation is excessive and widely dispersed, not localized, and not confined to specific areas.

Type: suspension

Category: Failed_integrity_onsite_check

Unlock date:

Lock date: 22.11.2024

Lock Description (en): During the Integrity on-site check carried out on 19th of November 2024, the auditor raised 3KOs in the following requirements: 2.3.9.1During the IOC, several records of the metal detector control have been checked. In some lines the detector has been considered as CP and in others as CCP. According to the HACCP system of the company they have to check the metal detector at the beginning and at the end of the shift and every product change. According to the records observed, the control is only done at the beginning of the production. Some examples:- 5.11.24, - 8.11.24, - 12.11.24, -18.11.24, 4.2.1.3 During the review of the documentation, several raw material specifications have been requested and in some cases were not available, e.g:- Surimi- Mayonnaise -Mushroom. In some cases, the specifications were not up to date which results in not all labels indicating the correct ingredients. 4.18.1 During the audit, a traceability test was carried out on a batch of battered chicken. During the audit it was found that there is no data on the defrosting dates of the different raw materials and there is no traceability of the labels, which contain legal information. During the visit to the facilities, it was observed that the batches of the raw materials are not always noted down, for example the cream in the meat sauce, sometimes batches other than those actually used are noted down in the records, e.g. ‘Tabertander’. Furthermore, there is no evidence that the different process records have been filled in: daily control of brittle material or daily control of rinsing of equipment after cleaning. and a Major NC in the req. 4.19.2 There is no evidence that the company has implemented adequate measures to minimize allergen cross-contamination. During the plant visit, the presence of several broken containers with allergens was observed, as in the case of flour or Tarbertander, and other deteriorated containers with products no containing allergens were also observed. There is no segregation between allergen and non-allergen raw materials, semi-processed products or final products, and storage is sometimes inadequate due to lack of space. The company has assessed this possible cross-contamination in its HACCP system and as a control measure has decided to do only one allergen analysis per year on one product. This analytical frequency is not risk-based.

Lock Description (en): During the unannounced audit conducted by IFS, the following KO and the following major non-conformity have been detected: KO in the requirement 4.18.1: Missing batches of packaging material and bicarbonate in the traceability test carried out during the audit (product pepper hummus batch 9665 brand C). Some bags with plastic cups and a container with bicarbonate were observed without batch identification in production area. Lock Description (en): During the recertification audit carried out on 27 and 28/01/2025, the following major non-conformity has been detected in requirement 4.3.2: In the product for which the traceability exercise was performed, there is evidence that the name of the product and the list of ingredients include the name of an ingredient with a registered trademark. Type: withdrawal

Category: ifs_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 12.02.2025

Lock Description (en): 4.13.4. Major: A rodent infestation problem has been identified and not all necessary measures for its eradication have been implemented prior to food manufacturing. Evidence: On 13.12.24 one dead rat was identified in kneading area, also a very strong odour was identified in offices since 10.12.24. The pest control company closes the incident on 20.12.24. On 03.01.25, after the Christmas holidays, rodent droppings and gnawed sacks of raw materials were observed. The actions were to clean the premises, throw away the gnawed sacks and notify the pest control company. The pest control company did not act until 7.01.25. On the same day, 07.01.25, production was resumed without having eliminated the infestation. 13.01.25 incidence of rodent activity was detected in the false ceiling area of the shed. 03.02.25 EPE 19 gnawed (bottom of ovens) rodenticide was applied. 4.19.1. Major: During the investigation of allergen information on ingredient datasheets, the following was detected: In the submitted Datasheet Shine Skin Pumpkin Seed AA Organic, Ref A00903-397/1572/1303 v01 12.09.23, supplier M. (distributor), it states Nuts ‘Traces’ but, in the breakdown of the different nuts (almonds, hazelnuts, walnuts, cashew nuts, pecans, Brazil nuts, pistachios, macadamia nuts) each is listed as not present. All Regulation 1169/2011 allergens are present in the declaration. The audited company did not identify this inconsistency. The company also did not include the possible traces of nuts in its allergen plan (nor in the labeling). During the audit, clarifications were requested from the Distributor. The Distributor submitted a new Datasheet, Organic Shine Skin AA Pumpkin Seed, v01 11.02.25 claiming that the lots purchased by the audited company did not contain Nuts (Ref A00903-1634 LOT: PC1614552/034, PC1614222/124). The supplier was asked for evidence on the basis of which he produced a new corrected Technical File. The supplier sent an (anonymous) Manufacturer's Technical Data Sheet stating that there are no allergens.

Type: withdrawal

Category: ifs_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 23.01.2025

Lock Description (en): During the audit performed on 21st January 2025 to 22nd January 2025, it was detected a Major non-conformity under the requirement 4.19.3. Major non-conformity 4.19.3. Wheat flour suppliers VILAF, HA. GU. and HA.DEL M. all of them declare traces of mustard and soy in the raw material wheat flour according to their technical data sheet in the latest version in force. All products manufactured contain wheat flour from one of these suppliers. However, the company has not declared the traces of mustard and soy in the final labeling of its products, it is considered a breach of Regulation (EU) 1169/2011 on the provision of food information to consumers.

Lock Description (other language): Durante la auditoría llevada a cabo del 21 de enero de 2025 al 22 de enero de 2025, se detectó una No Conformidad Mayor bajo el requisito 4.19.3. No Conformidad Mayor 4.19.3. Se revisan los proveedores de harina de trigo VILAF., HA. GU. y HA.DEL M. todos ellos declaran trazas de mostaza y soja en la materia prima harina trigo según su ficha técnica en la última versión vigente. Todos los productos fabricados contienen harina de trigo de alguno de estos proveedores. Sin embargo, la empresa no ha declarado las trazas de mostaza y soja en el etiquetado final de sus productos, se considera un incumpliendo del Reglamento (UE) 1169/2011 sobre la información alimentaria facilitada al consumidor.

Type: suspension

Category: Failed_integrity_onsite_check

Unlock date:

Lock date: 22.03.2024

Lock Description (en): During the Integrity On-site Check completed on site on 20-MAR-2024 the following Major NC and KOs were identified: 2.2.1.2 MAJOR For the product “Frozen sheep cream”, packed in 20 l bag in box, there is no evidence that the product´s hazard analysis has been considered within the scope of the HACCP. The first steps of the production are the same than the ones for the refrigerated fresh sheep cream, and after being packed, the product is delivered to a third party freezing company. For this last part of the process there is no evidence of hazard analysis and assessment of the associated risks. In addition, several issues have been observed related to the product and process: • The label of the product is written in English, despite the product is sold to Spanish customer. • The freezing company is a meat cutting room and frozen warehouse, only approved for the Spanish veterinary number key number 10 (meat products). • There is no specification “Frozen sheep cream”. Also, defrosted “sheep butter” labeled with the brand “Gaza” was observed in the cold storage chamber. This product is not included in the scope of the IFS certification. The company declares this is a product that is not being produced anymore. 4.12.8 MAJOR There are no procedures in place describing the measures to be taken for the management of the curd clay pot breakages in the line, and this hazard has not been assessed in the HACCP either. During the on-site visit broken pieces of clay material were observed inside the filling machine, in the exterior edges of the machine and also under the machine. Besides this, production records do not show any clay breakage in 2024. Several records from 2023 were also checked and no breakage has been recorded either. 4.18.1 KO For the clay pot, the traceability batch recorded in the production record relates to the packaging material reference provided by the supplier, and not the product batch itself. Therefore, in all traceability records from years 2023 and 2024 observed, the batch recorded is always the same (reference number R2036-TE-003). Batch number is a different code (DB9). The person in charge of the traceability assurance in the line was not aware that this was the batch number. Also, during the on site visit, a partially used pallet containing clay pots without any identification was observed in the curd filling room. According to the worker in the line, these belong to the last batch used. However, as described above, the batches of previous productions is also missing information. 4 5.4.1 MAJOR The company has not identified the probes of the cold storage chambers as critical measurement devices to ensure compliance with food safety and product quality requirements. Therefore, they are not included in the calibration plan, and there is no evidence that the probes have been ever calibrated. The products stored in these chambers are raw materials as pasteurized egg, and also finished products as fresh milk and cream. During the audit completed on site on 24-25-26/09/2024 the following Major NC and KO were identified: Requirement: 5.11.3 K.O.: Effectiveness of corrective action plan Deviation: In relation to the monitoring of the corrective action plan derived from the deviations of the previous certification audit dated November 15 and 16, 2023 and the integrity program dated March 20, 2024, deviations have been detected that have not been effectively closed and that are repeated in the present audit: From the integrity program, 4.18.1 In relation to traceability: + The start of a new roll of welding strip (material in contact with the product) is observed in the Tetra pak packaging on September 24, 2024, where the new batch of strip being used is not recorded (note: the time of the control carried out when the strip is changed is indicated). + During the on-site audit process, it was detected that the 20-litre box of bags used for packaging pasteurised cream did not present information about its batch and traceability. A box from the warehouse was presented with the batch identification but it did not match the one registered. 4.10.7 Regarding the control of hoses, new signage from April 17, 2024 is available with the identification of the correct placement of hoses, however, in this audit cases are detected with hoses and nozzles in contact with the ground. A peroxide pump is observed on the Elopak line with the hose and nozzle in direct contact with the ground. Outside the plant in the raw milk reception area, the arrangement of a blue hose with nozzles in direct contact with the ground is observed. Suction tube with nozzle in contact with the ground and located in the ingredient mixing equipment.5.3.1 The rejection valve test of the heat treatment equipment with a valve opening system and product diversion when the temperatures are not reached has not been defined in a planned manner, for example: lactase vapor barrier, pasteurizer. 4.9.9.1 Regarding infrastructure incidents, actions are pending in the milk and cream chamber (skirting boards, etc.) and are planned for April 12, 2024 and pending execution. 4.9.4.1 Regarding the ceiling with foam remains in the curd cooling tunnel, actions are planned for July 22, 2024 and pending treatment and execution. 4.9.6.1 A hit door is detected that does not close effectively and no immediate actions are established to mitigate the possible entry of pests. 5.10.1 Contrary to the provisions of the PCA-01 procedure for non-conformities dated (April 24, 2024), containers of pasteurized sheep cream are observed in a refrigeration chamber with an expired expiration date and it is not unequivocally identified on site as a non-conforming product, example: batch 18524 with expiration date August 5, 2024. Requirement: 4.17.5 Major: Change in equipment Deviation: The modification of the triblender equipment (equipment for adding ingredients) is observed, its position is modified and it is moved to another room to carry out the mixtures. In this room there are bags with the different ingredients used. There is no risk assessment in relation to the new arrangement and associated preventive measures, in this new arrangement there is no longer a dust extractor and different ingredients such as oats are dosed in this equipment.

Type: withdrawal

Category: ifs_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 29.11.2024

Lock Description (en): During the re-certification audit, a major non-conformity has been detected in requirement 5.4.1: With regard to the documentation for measurement equipment control, the following issues are evident: • There is no documentation regarding the metrological verification of the scale (Serial No. 1633) used for big bag weighing (variable weight sales). • The weight control of sacks can be carried out on various scales, but only one of them has documentation of metrological verification (Kern 1). In the weight control reports, the specific scale used for the weight control is not recorded, making it impossible to determine whether the scale with metrological verification documentation is the one being used. • The metrological verification certificate does not include the authorization number of the verification body (tank scale and Kern 1 sack scale).

Lock Description (other language): Durante la auditoria de re-certificación, se ha detectado una no conformidad mayor en el requisito 5.4.1.: Con respecto a la documentación de control de equipos de medida, se evidencia: - No hay documentación sobre verificación metrológica en la báscula (Nº serie 1633) de bigbag (venta a peso variable) - El control de peso de sacos se puede hacer en varias básculas, sólo una de ellas tiene documentación de verificación metrológica (Kern 1). En los partes del control de peso, no se registra la báscula en la que se hace el control de peso, de manera que se pueda conocer si la báscula que se utiliza es la que tiene documentación de verificación metrológica. - En el certificado de verificación metrológica no aparece el nº de autorización de organismo de verificación (báscula de cisternas y báscula de sacos kern 1)

Type: withdrawal

Category: ifs_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 08.11.2024

Lock Description (en): During the audit carried out on 06th and 07th of November, the auditor raised a KO in the requirement 4.18.1: During the traceability test, the company documents the batches of raw materials used to produce the PRODUCT LIGHT CANDY WITH PINE NUTS WITHOUT ADDED SUGARS LOT L4328, but it is verified that the identification of the batches of raw materials correspond to delivery notes of entries with dates after the production date of the PRODUCT LIGHT CANDY WITH PINE NUTS WITHOUT ADDED SUGARS LOT L4328, so the traceability computer system is not working correctly.

Type: suspension

Category: ifs_audit

Unlock date:

Lock date: 25.10.2024

Lock Description (en): Non Conformity Major 4.9.8.3. Upon leaving the oven, the baked product tray trolleys are placed in a ventilated area for cooling. During the audit, it was detected that an evaporator located in the upper part of this area was leaking a few centimeters from the trolleys present at this time, with the risk of contamination of the finished product. The operators often move the trolleys according to the needs of the production process: there is no safety area where the trolleys should not be parked (no product zone). According to the maintenance manager, the evaporator leaks in relation to weather conditions (gusts of wind), which can occur unpredictably. Furthermore, following the investigation carried out by the communication of 3 Potential Non-conformities after the Integrity witness audit carried out on auditor Nicolas Maire and confirming them, it is necessary to change the status from suspension to withdrawal, and include the additional non-conformities that imply the change of status, which are the following: 1. Non Conformity KO 4.12.1 : “Implementation of the measures to guarantee absence of foreign bodies was not adequate during the audit. The following situations where potential foreign bodies may pose a risk for the product were observed during the on-site visit: - Damaged felp (cotton) conveyor belt used to transport the formed dough. The colour of the conveyor is the same than the flour. - Damaged textile hose (frayed) to transport the flour from the silo to the ingredient mixer. The colour of the is the same than the flour. This was already observed in the previous IFS Food audit. - Adhesive tapes used to retain the methacrylate covers of machines while operating (product inside). - Knives nailed on the dough were observed while waiting to be kneaded. - Broken brittle: Protective cover of a clock placed on a column above working table (loss of the piece of plastic broken); cracked light lamp in the changing rooms; Security methacrylate cover of the metal detector (loss of a piece). None of these issues have been reported in the internal inspections. In none of the checked foreign bodies internal inspections the company has noticed about such issues. Also, an issue regarding the management of potential foreign bodies was not correctly managed during the audit: The microperfored silicone coated trays for the ovens are chipped in some areas. The company stated they re-coat them periodically. During the audit, with the first product passed through the metal detector when the auditor came by, there was a positive detection in the metal detector. To address this, the worker opened the product bag and passed small quantities of loose product (handfuls) through the metal detector. Every handful passed without being metal-detected was thrown by the worker to the bulk product container to be packed (reprocessed). This procedure is not adequate, as it allows potential contamination to be spread into conforming product. When he finished emptying the pack, he easily found a black material at the bottom of the bag that he immediately recognized as “chipped part of the trays”. No further action was taken. Most of these silicone coated trays show areas of chipping and damage.” 2. Non Conformity Major 4.13.2 : “Evidence of pests presence in different areas of the facilities was observed by the IFS IP Auditor. - Presence of vinegar flies in the sourdough machine (product was being processed inside). - Presence of vinegar flies in a flour bag in production area. - Flies in production area were observed in some spots (“picos” packing machine, kneader), despite the company has mosquito nets in windows. - Mouse droppings were observed in the upper floor, at the bottom of the raw material/auxiliary material warehouse, near a pipe. There is no specific corrective action open in the company in regard to insect control.” 3. Non Conformity Major 4.3.2 : The product selected for the traceability test is “Regañás con aceite de oliva virgen extra 150 g.”. The ingredients shown in the ingredient list are (in English): Wheat flour (gluten), water, extra virgin oil, wheat, mother dough (gluten), sesame seeds, salt, yeast. This product is manufactured for a third company (H.E.A.), that trades the product for a retailer (under the third company´s brand). During the review of the ingredients of the dough, it was observed that; - Wheat flour used is a “conditioned flour”, and it contains an antioxidant (e-300) and stabilizer (e-920), which is not declared in the labelling of the finished product. - Dry yeast contains an emulgent (e-491), which is not declared in the labelling of the finished product. The product is labelled with a claim: “Clean label”.
